DOC.brief_summary: The aim study investigate clinical effectiveness protocol-driven cognitive behavioral therapy ( CBT ) insomnia deliver ordinary primary care personnel ( primary care nurse social worker ) general medical practice unselected patient , line step care approach . The study design randomise controlled parallel group design , allocation CBT wait list control group ( WL ) . Following active treatment-control period , control group re-assigned CBT . The study hypothesis CBT group would experience less symptom insomnia treatment compare WL group . Primary outcome measure brief self-report screening form , Insomnia severity index .
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Behavior Therapy Insomnia Primary Care
DOC.criteria: Fulfilled research criterion chronic insomnia untreated sleep disturbance pregnancy shift work concurrent medical psychiatric condition could negatively affected treatment drug abuse severe depression dementia
